io.github.steviebeenz.nope.modules.data

Interface Option

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigOption, PlayerOption

    public interface Option
    A simple interface to represent options
    Author:
    imodm

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean asBoolean()
      Returns the current value casted to Boolean
      default double asDouble()
      Returns the current value from Number.doubleValue()
      default float asFloat()
      Returns the current value from Number.floatValue()()
      default int asInteger()
      Returns the current value from Number.intValue()()
      default long asLong()
      Returns the current value from Number.longValue()
      default short asShort()
      Returns the current value from Number#shortValue()Value()
      String getKey()
      This should return a unique identifier for a specific option.
      List<? extends Object> getOptions()
      Returns the list of options, the first item in this list should be the default
      <T> T getValue()
      Returns the current value of the option
      default <T> T getValue(Class<T> cast)
      Returns the current value casted to the specified class
      default boolean isDefault()
      Check if the value set is also the first option
      <T> T set(T value)
      Set a value, should be used for Strings or non-boolean values.
      <T> T toggle()
      Toggle a value, this can be used to iterate through the list of getOptions().

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        @Nonnull
String getKey()
        This should return a unique identifier for a specific option.
        Returns:

      • toggle

        <T> T toggle()
        Toggle a value, this can be used to iterate through the list of getOptions().
        Returns:
        The result of what the *NEW* value is, return null if this operation is unsupported.

      • set

        @Nullable
<T> T set(T value)
        Set a value, should be used for Strings or non-boolean values.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting object, most likely will just be @param value This can also be null if an invalid value was specified
